Description: Water completely soften consists in the removal of cations mainly calcium and magnesium which are exchanged or replaced for another cation that cannot form scale as it is much more soluble such as sodium or chloride ions. The most common means for reduction of hard water relies on ion exchange resins or reverse osmosis; in limited circumstances, it is performed  through the use of chemicals additives specially, lime softening (WaterProfessionals, 2017).;;Ion exchange water softening process, apart from being the most conventional method, it is also the oldest method used to remove calcium and magnesium ions from water. It  comprises a cation exchange resin on which the mobile ion inside the bed is typically sodium. When hard water passes through the resin, hardness ions (Mg2+ and Ca2+) move into the resin bed and each cation is replaced by two sodium ions getting out of the resin. Water salinity does not change, only the constituents of salinity. ;;Once capacity is exhausted, a water softener must be regenerated using salt. The regeneration process consists on backwash, brine draw/slow rinse, fast rinse and refill.
